comment: A lot of papers for an elective class (in my opinion). midterm paper, research paper, final paper. 4 quizzes but you get 10 attempts each. pretty easy grader tho
rating_tags: Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: Dudes a little weird but overall his class is good, all test are open book/note but with lockdown and camera but just use your phone or iPad and say its for notes. All the answers for everything are in the powerpoint and if you just skim them no need to go to class. Overall hes a nice guy and his class is easy.

Prof. Givens is a very knowledgeable professor. He extends dates & gives multiple attempts on tests & quizzes. However, his lectures are very long, advanced and detailed which will make you feel like you're in a master program class rather than a gen ed class. He does not teach at a beginner level, and will ask the students a ton of questions.

Took the class 'Global Issues' as a foreign exchange student at KSU in 2021, and was really impressed with both the class contents as well as the professor's engagement and substance knowledge. Regardless of major, I think everyone should take 'Global Issues' to gain perspective and understand how the world works!
Super nice guy and relaxed on due dates. You get multiple attempts on everything, even midterms. Everything comes straight from his powerpoints and he makes lectures interesting.
Great teacher, very fun and interesting. But the homework in the textbook can take a while todo.

Dr. Givens was great. He was not as active during class, but he is an easy grader and very understanding. He created deadlines for discussion posts, but as long as they were finished by the end of the semester, he was not strict on the deadline.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Professor givens is an excellent guy who really cares about his students, he is very smart and will help you get the grade you desire, just talk to him he is very nice and will help you a lot
If you miss any of the assignments he'll just open it back up & he curves the final, everything is participation except tests, which are lock down browser but open note.

This professor is very lecture heavy and his lectures have almost nothing to do with the tests. There are three and I failed all three, but he has homework every week and activites that will help your grade. You will need the textbook because that will help a little with the tests and you can use notes and the book during them.

He doesn't have a hard class, he just has no idea what he is talking about. Quizzes are usually open note and online. The class should be an Easy A, but he is so genuinely confusing and unclear with directions and instruction. He takes forever to grade and doesn't give clear feedback. You will not understand what you are supposed to be learning.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: I have take professor Givens for two classes! He is extremely knowledgeable in East Asian politics and his lectures(powerpoint) are filled with great details. I learned so much from both of his classes and have used his lectures for research in other classes.

Professor Givens loves history and tries to keep the class engaged. There is a midterm and final worth 15 each. Test answers are on quizlet. Weekly Inquizitive assignments which are super easy worth 15. Simple group project worth 30. Doesn't take attendance but gives in-class assignments worth 10. And 2 political events worth 15. No book. Easy A
He is very boring but he is very helpful and doesn't require too much work from his students. Talk to him, email him and he will make sure you get what you need.
rating_tags: Participation matters--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Dr. Givens is an excellent professor. His exams were online with unlimited times to take the exam. His lectures are fun & creative. Honestly, he's pretty fine to look at. There is a midterm & final paper but no actual exam. He gives great feedback on your work & wants to help you succeed. You will leave his class feeling like you learned something.

John is an amazing professor that teaches an amazing class! attendance is not mandatory until really the very end when he does "in class assignments" but class is pretty good. GET THE ONLINE TEXT BOOK! it makes the homework so easy. 2 tests, midterm and final and you get two tries on both tests. one major group project. He is so easy take him!!

Pretty simple class, you have inquizitive homeworks which you should get 100%'s on, a group project which wasn't bad, and online midterm and final which was open note. You should get a good grade if you want one. He's a cool guy, nerdy but not in a bad way. Lectures might get boring sometimes because you don't really NEED to take notes.

I threw in the chili pepper simply because he wore a button-down with rubber ducks on it to class the other day and it made me giggle internally. He's an interesting guy and a pretty decent grader. Grades consist of participation, 2 essay exams, and a short paper. Pro Tip: ask him about the East Asian island dispute

I've had him for both POLS4452 & POLS4438 and I can honestly say he's one of the best professors. He's more than willing to work with you so you get the most out of his class & get the best grade possible. Lots of papers, but he grades fairly; it's not hard to pass. Funny lectures, A+ outfits. If I could take him for every single class I would.

Hes a very knowledgeable teacher if you take the time to go to class, but I literally NEVER go because there is really no reason to go unless you want to listen to him talk. All you have is a debate, a group project, EASY homework, an online midterm and online final. He's a cool guy and his class is very manageable and easy and you can learn a lot
rating_tags: Tests? Not many--GROUP PROJECTS--Would take again

comment: His lectures are GREAT! He explains everything and is funny. He is not a tough grader, just talk to him. Come to class, he has random group assignments that is for a grade. He is REALLY smart and knows this subject. He is cool if you turn anything in late. 1 midterm, 1 final, 1 essay and reading quiz. He let us take the midterm twice online.

Excellent lecturer. Grades papers fairly but thoroughly, and is flexible on deadlines (within reason). Easy to communicate with and he gives good feedback on essays. Participation matters much not as much as the essay exams.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Easy and fun class. There are some very easy in class assignments, some political participation things like a series of tweets or going to a rally/protest/etc, midterm & final, and an essay. He's very funny and likes to talk and interact with the class. Be prepared to answer questions.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: His class breakdown is so easy. He assigns one paper due before Spring break, and his 3 exams are a choice from 3 essay topics, you choose two. Open book, super flexible about pushing exams back. He dresses very hipster because he is semi young, and talks so fast like he's had 8 cups of coffee. I'm taking him for next semester for sure.
